meanings.definition: A tool with a pointed, typically iron head, used for breaking up hard ground or rock.
meanings.sent1: The miner used a pickax to break the large rocks.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker carried a pickax to the excavation site.
meanings.sent3: The pickax and shovel had a race to see who could dig faster.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a pickax, breaking through the barriers in her way.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the pickax hitting the rock echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To use a pickax to break up or loosen something.
meanings.sent1: He will pickax the frozen ground to plant the seeds.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist pickaxed carefully to uncover the ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The chef pickaxed the hard butter to soften it for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: She pickaxed through the clutter in her room to find her lost earring.
meanings.sent5: The team pickaxed through the dense forest to clear a path for the hikers.
